subj_and_aspectrix module¶

class subj_and_aspectrix.Subjects_and_aspects(corpus)[source]¶

Bases: argumentatrix.Arguments

This module finds pairs of arguments

__init__(corpus)[source]¶

This module looks for pairwise expressions in the horizon of a predicate.

annotate(opposed_pair_pair=None, graph_coro_subj_asp=None, graph_coro_arg_binding=None, paint_graph=True)[source]¶

Annotates the correlations, that means expressions that are similar to each other and are distinct from the pair, that was found as excluding each other. For instance ‘from the one side’ and ‘from the other side’.

In part the graph is cleaned, because also exmaples can be marked as seemingly contradictions. On the other side the same operation is done for additional (sub)predications in context, following coreferential relations

What is a subject and what a subject is decided on the sequence in respect to the theme-rheme-distinction. What you speak about, comes first, the subject. With what you want to divide this thing up, is the aspect. If you change the direction of explanation, this also changes. E.g. If you are in the first sentence talking about microsoft warranties, and secondly you explain different cases, you speak about warranty. If you start with these cases and then tell, that in one case you have in the other not warranty, you speak about these cases.

Parameters:
  • opposed_pair_pair – 2tuple-2tuple-list-predicate-dicts, so 4 predicates in contradicting/corralating constellation
  • graph_coro – coroutine to connect the subjects and aspects to debug their bindings
  • graph_coro_arg_binding – coroutine to connect subject and aspects to their predicates
